Articles.Content: Can i removed item pick up to inventory?????

Feature requests:

- allow attachment of parts that are "too heavy" but already aligned.

Instead of flat "need more kerbal" do ghost the part, but don't allow moving it. If it's in the right place, it should turn blue and pressing H would attach it.

That way, if I use "other methods" (like a gantry) to put the part in place, I need just one engineer to use it in construction instead of bringing a whole herd of kerbals to do what machinery should be doing.

- scale kerbal max allowable carried mass to body gravity.

You're already scaling the kerbal movement. Just make it so that with mass exceeded the kerbal can't walk at all (say, they packed 4 tons of stuff into pockets on Minmus, then went on EVA on Kerbin), but set the mass limit to gravity of the body - if I can lift an engine on Kerbin, I should be well able to lift four on Minmus, and ten on Gilly.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Sharpy said:
> 
> 
> - allow attachment of parts that are "too heavy" but already aligned.
> 

This feature is much more complicated than you may guess. When you move around a part using <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> it always knows the target, it's the part that is being pointed by the mouse. In case of connecting two unrelated parts (even though they stay close to each other) another logic has to be implemented. Also, parts that may look properly aligned can be in fact **not** aligned (e.g. by 5mm which you will unlikely notice). Not a big deal for the ground base but can be a huge issue for a flying vessel due to imbalance.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Sharpy said:
> 
> 
> - scale kerbal max allowable carried mass to body gravity.
> 

This issue is covered in the new "physics" approach in <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>. It's a big feature which I plan to implement long term. I described it somewhere in this thread (like 6-7 months ago).

In general, all <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> features are currently on hold since I'm focused on launching <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> 1.0.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, IgorZ said:
> 
> 
> This feature is much more complicated than you may guess. When you move around a part using <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> it always knows the target, it's the part that is being pointed by the mouse. In case of connecting two unrelated parts (even though they stay close to each other) another logic has to be implemented. Also, parts that may look properly aligned can be in fact **not** aligned (e.g. by 5mm which you will unlikely notice). Not a big deal for the ground base but can be a huge issue for a flying vessel due to imbalance.
> 

Another approach: allow the several cm wiggle room; not enough to make transporting the part viable by a single kerbal, but enough to allow for this error?

It's OK that things are on hold. Just add it somewhere to the bottom of the list ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") And <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> definitely could use a better documentation. I only learned you can connect ports without use of winches when someone suggested this to me...
Add a tool or set of tools allowing heavy things which are close to be pulled into place? I can use a screw jack or a chain ratchet binder  to shift 10 tons of vehicle easily enough.

BTW, feel free to push the 'attach heavy but aligned things' way to the bottom of idea bin. Yesterday I attached a 10-ton tank to an 8-ton rover using one engineer, one screwdriver, one gantry, and two docking ports ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I am having problem with even getting into container it would give me the error check installation path open/close sounds missing is there anyway I can just run the mod without sound? Also I cannot take off or put on the helmet but I don't get an error for it there just no option to do so.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-21T20:52:32Z" title="09/21/2016 08:52  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 21, 2016</time> by greg104240**

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, greg104240 said:
> 
> 
> I am having problem with even getting into container it would give me the error check installation path open/close sounds missing is there anyway I can just run the mod without sound? Also I cannot take off or put on the helmet but I don't get an error for it there just no option to do so.
> 

This looks as an installation problem. In order to have <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> working all the paths to the resources must resolve. De-install <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>, double check is there are <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> left-offs in other folders (and cleanup them), then re-install from the fresh archive. Remember that you cannot change installation path of the mod. It must live in GameData/<abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> folder. Changing file structure will result in errors loading different files.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-21T23:45:56Z" title="09/21/2016 11:45  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 21, 2016</time> by IgorZ**

Heads up.

Thanks to [@micha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113840-micha/) we have a patch for KSP 1.2. I haven't tried it myself yet (didn't have chance to install 1.2) but I at least it should be compiling. Once KSP 1.2 is out I'll release <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> 1.2.13 to support new KSP version.

UPD. New <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> version will go in a new forum thread (I'll put a link here). Don't get surprised.

I've added an [issue](https://github.com/KospY/KIS/issues/174)to the tracker: Laboratories can't be added to inventory.

Not a big problem in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, but totally rained all over my plans to make my Minmus base self-sufficient with OSE Workshop. (it can't build science parts, including antennas, without a lab attached. I attached a "guest visiting" lab to build one "native" and the workshop just got totally clogged.)

Known issue but thanks for adding extra background. I've updated the original bug with these details.

Is the "drag a subassembly into a container" thing still planned for future updates, or not anymore?

Basically, the ability to build something (rover) in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, save it as a subassembly, drop it into a big enough container, and later use a kerbal to extract the full subassembly from the container.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, -ctn- said:
> 
> 
> Is the "drag a subassembly into a container" thing still planned for future updates, or not anymore?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Basically, the ability to build something (rover) in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, save it as a subassembly, drop it into a big enough container, and later use a kerbal to extract the full subassembly from the container.
> 

I was investigating this feature and figured out it would be too complicated to implement on the existing <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> codebase. So, for now storing sub-assemblies is not in the queue.

For moving big objects, I was thinking something like a little power assist unit that could increase the kerbals lifting capacity, or something bigger like the one from aliens.

Just had a quick play with it and while it compiles, it doesn't actually work. You can add items to containers, but can't do anything with them in flight (apart from moving them between containers).  Heaps of nullref exceptions as well as errors when initialising things in CTORs when they should be initialised in the Awake() or Start() overloads instead (had the same problem with OMS).

I'll see if I can get some time to debug further - my interest up to now was only to get KEES compiled :-)

> 
> 
> 18 hours ago, micha said:
> 
> 
> Just had a quick play with it and while it compiles, it doesn't actually work.
> 

So I updated to KSP 1.2.0.1540, made a few more fixes, and it seems to be working now. No detailed testing, but I can attach and detach batteries and the KEES PC (the bit I'm actually interested in right now).

[https://github.com/KospY/<abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>/pull/173](https://github.com/KospY/KIS/pull/173)

If anybody else wants to test this, remember that you will also need to recompile the [KSPDev](https://github.com/ihsoft/KSPDev) plugin before compiling <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>.

Re-rooting the vessel using <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> and <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> "mid flight" is completely doable right now, though a little of a hassle.

You might consider if this avenue could be wrapped into a neat command or part - definitely no need to rewrite <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> re-rooting from scratch.

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/148834-re-rooting-a-vessel-mid-flight-with-kiskas/&do=embed"></iframe>

(e.g. a small part that is a probe core always marked as "station" or higher; attach it to the part you want to be root, force vessel save/load cycle (scene change), detach it - done.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-28T10:14:01Z" title="09/28/2016 10:14  AM" data-short="7 yr">September 28, 2016</time> by Sharpy**

Is it possible to attach decouplers with <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)"><abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">kis</abbr></abbr>? I want to build a shuttle to launch to laythe, and then attach new boosters built with EL to come home.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-29T17:19:40Z" title="09/29/2016 05:19  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 29, 2016</time> by Errol**

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, Errol said:
> 
> 
> Is it possible to attach decouplers with <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)"><abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">kis</abbr></abbr>? I want to build a shuttle to launch to laythe, and then attach new boosters built with EL to come home.
> 

Yes, you can attach anything.  <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> doesn't create parts, though, just attach/detach, so you have to bring the decouplers with you (or some other way to make them, like EPL or OSE Workshop).

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, hab136 said:
> 
> 
> Yes, you can attach anything.  <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> doesn't create parts, though, just attach/detach, so you have to bring the decouplers with you (or some other way to make them, like EPL or OSE Workshop).
> 

Anything?  I found myself unable to attach EVA transfer pipes.  I misunderstood and put them in inventory instead of connecting them to the rocket in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, when I pulled one out of inventory and tried to connect two rockets--and it wouldn't connect.
You need two connectors. One on each vessel.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Tarheel1999 said:
> 
> 
> You need two connectors. One on each vessel.
> 

What I'm saying is that if you have one of those pipes in your hand it's impossible to connect it to a vessel.  You have to put them on in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> and then a Kerbal can run the hose from one to another.

> 
> 
> 14 minutes ago, Loren Pechtel said:
> 
> 
> What I'm saying is that if you have one of those pipes in your hand it's impossible to connect it to a vessel.  You have to put them on in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> and then a Kerbal can run the hose from one to another.
> 

That's not true. Not only is it possible to connect them to vessels, that's what they are designed to do. Does your kerbal on EVA have a tool (wrench or electric screwdriver) equipped? As long as you are carrying the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> pipe port and have a tool equipped, you should be able to attach it to any part that allows surface attaching no problem. 

I don't remember for sure (since I do all my EVA work with Engineers) but I seem to recall that the electric screwdriver can only be used by Engineers, but the wrench can be used by anyone. I'm pretty sure that for a simple <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> pipe port either tool will do.
